intro: Wurfbainia geostachyoides, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with upright stems and clustered leaves. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, blue, and white, and are often cultivated for ornamental purposes. Wurfbainia geostachyoides prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
